result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Court calls case at 9:15 a.m. Defendant Gregory A Dye in court with attorney Jonathan E. Barnett. Defendant Gregory A Dye in custody. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases heard today: 14CF148 for initial and plea, 13CF185, 13CF214, 13CF295, 13CF376, and 14CF38.  Amended Information filed for 14CF148, 13CF185, and 13CF214.  Waived readings of amended informations.

13CF148 Initial Appearance:
Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement for cases pleading to today: W/H Sentenced:  24 mo Probation:  Conditions:  No contact with Patricia Walport and comply with any family court orders.   Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription  and be taken according to the prescription. Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming controlled substances or drug paraphernalia..   Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.  Pay costs.
14CF148 amended: 
13CF185 amended ct 1:
13CF185 ct 2: to be DRI
13CF214 amended:
13CF295: to be DRI
13CF376 ct 1 & 2:
13CF376 ct 3 & 4: to be DRI
14CF38: to be DRI
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:  
14CF148 amended: Guilty
13CF185 amended Ct 1: Guilty
13CF214 amended:   Guilty
13CF376 ct 1 & 2:  Guilty

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorney stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 14CF148 amended, 13CF185 amended Ct 1 ,13CF214 amended, 13CF376 ct 1 & 2. Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.  13CF295, 13CT376 cts 3 & 4 and 14CF38 are Dismissed Read In.

ADA Cousins makes sentencing statements.
Court request the Atty Barnett to get the information from the jail and calculate the jail credit and may stipulate to them.
Atty Barnett concurs with the joint recommendation.

BTC:************************PROBATION**********

14CF148: 946.49(1)(a) Bail Jump-Misd:  W/H Sentence 24 mo Probation, concurrent with 13CF185:  Comply with same probation conditions as set forth in 13CF185. Pay costs and DNA surcharge $200.00.  14 days credit if revoked.

13CF185: ct 1: 947.01(1) Disorderly Conduct-Misd:  W/H Sentence 2 yrs Probation:  Conditions:  No direct or indirect contact with Patricia Walport and comply with any family court orders in place involving his child.   Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription  and be taken according to the prescription. Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.  Follow any further recommendations and comply in any other counseling/treatment reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.  Pay costs.  Jail credit to be determined either by stipulation or hearing if disputed.

13CF214: 946.49(1) (a) Bail Jump-Misd: W/H Sentence 24 mo Probation, concurrent with 13CF185:  Comply with same probation conditions as set forth in 13CF185. Pay costs.

13CF376 ct 1: Possess THC-Misd: W/H Sentence 24 mo Probation, concurrent with 13CF185:  Comply with same probation conditions as set forth in 13CF185. Pay costs. 

13CF376 ct 2: Possess Paraphernalia-Misd: W/H Sentence 24 mo Probation, concurrent with 13CF185:  Comply with same probation conditions as set forth in 13CF185. Pay costs.
Plea hearing on April 10, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 28, 2014 at 10:00 am.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUITLY Plea entered.

Bond Continued.

Defendant Gregory A Dye in court with attorney Jonathan E. Barnett. Defendant Gregory A Dye in custody. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties are prepared to proceed. 

P. Omernik is called and sworn. 
Direct exam by Atty Cousins. 
Exhibit #1 is marked on behalf of the plaintiff and referred to.
Atty Cousins moves for the admission of Exhibit #1. 

BY THE COURT:  
Exhibit #1 is received. 

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial. 
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 7, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Gregory A Dye in court with attorney Jonathan E. Barnett. David Raymond Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews the file.   
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
  Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond Continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Gregory A Dye in court. David Raymond Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions if he has contacted the Public Defender.  They have not appointed one yet for this case.  Defendant received copy of criminal complaint and waives reading of same.  Atty Barnett is on the other case.
Bond continued.
  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Comply with conditions of bond in other Portage County files.  
-Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  *Patricia Walport or her daughter or her residence at 232 Prentice Street or be within 500 feet of the property. 
-Comply with requirements of the restraiting order that Ms. Walport or her daughter has against him. 
-Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  *7 days per week.
-Required to go to the Public Defenders office to have counsel appointed on this matter.

Defendant Gregory A Dye appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Cass Cousins appeared for State of Wisconsin.
Atty Cousins makes statements to the Court. 
Court questions defendant. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 
Atty Cousins recommends a cash bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Gregory A Dye
Current: PO Box 388, 1416 Main Street #11, Stevens Point, WI 54481   (Effective: 02-21-2014)
Prior: 1416 Main Street #11 PO Box 388, Stevens Point, WI 54481

Defendant Gregory A Dye not in court. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State provides a copy of the Affidavit of mailing.  Defendant is not present today.  BTC:  Probable cause is found and Court orders a Criminal Warrant $1,000 cash alternative.
